children.name: to accept that sth has legal or official authority
recognize
children.definition: /recogniseUK  to officially accept that it has legal or official authority: công nhận, thừa nhận
examples: recognize a court/ government/ qualification
Papua New Guinea was the first country to recognize the new military regime in Fiji.
British medical qualifications are recognized in many countries throughout the world.
recognition[U] C2 when a government, organization etc is officially accepted:
It was many years before the Communist government gained official recognition from the US government.

children.name: accept
children.definition: /əkˈsept/
examples: chấp nhận, thông qua
▪ The president refused to accept the authority of the state court when it tried to keep black students out of the University of Alabama.
Ngài Tổng thống từ chối thông qua quyền lực của tòa án quốc gia khi nó cố gắng đuổi một sinh viên da đen ra khỏi trường đại học Alabama
▪ The idea of a common defence force has been accepted by some EU governments.
Ý tưởng về sức mạnh quốc phòng chung đã được thông qua bởi vài chính phủ EU
acceptance[uncountable noun] widespread acceptance general acceptance
Sự chấp nhận, sự chấp thuận
▪ Authorities hope that the new regulations on smoking in public places will meet widespread acceptance.
Các nhà chức trách hi vọng rằng sự chỉnh đốn mới về việc hút thuốc nơi công cộng sẽ nhận được sự chấp thuận rộng rãi

children.name: acknowledge
children.definition: /əkˈnɒlɪdʒǁ-ˈnɑː-/  to officially accept that a government, court, organization, or person has legal or official authority: công nhận thừa nhận
examples: ▪ Zaire was forced to acknowledge the authority of the Congolese state.
be acknowledged as
▪ In 1932 De Valera was elected as Prime Minister, and was acknowledged as leader of the Irish people

children.name: to accept an offer orinvitation or request
accept
children.definition: /əkˈsept/  to say yes to an offer, an invitation, or a chance to do something:
examples: Chấp nhận, đồng ý
▪ I decided to accept the job.
Tôi quyết định sẽ chấp nhận công việc này
▪ The president has accepted an invitation to visit Beijing.
Ngày Thủ tướng đã chấp nhận lời mời đi thăm Bắc Kinh
▪ If they offered you a place on the course, would you accept it?
Nếu họ đưa ra cho bạn một vị trí thích hợp, liệu bạn có chấp nhận ?
▪ We’ve invited Professor Shaw to come and give a talk and she’s accepted.
Chúng ta đã mời Giáo sư Shaw đến và tham gia một buổi thảo luận và bà ấy đã đồng ý
acceptance[uncountable noun] formal when you officially accept something, such as a job offer:
Sự chấp nhận, sự chấp thuận
▪ She phoned the personnel department to confirm her acceptance of the job offer.
Cô ấy gọi điện bộ phận nhân sự và xác nhận sự chấp thuận về đề xuất công việc

children.name: agree
children.definition: /əˈgriː/ to say you will do what someone has asked you to do, especially something that may bedifficult,inconvenientetc:
examples: đồng ý, chấp nhận
▪ They’ve asked Tina to work overtime this week, and she’s agreed.
Họ đã yêu cầu Tina làm việc thêm giờ tuần rồi, và cô ấy đồng ý
agree to do something
đồng ý là điều gì
▪ I wish I had never agreed to teach Paul how to drive.
Tôi ước gì tôi đã không đồng ý dạy Paul lái xe
▪ I’ve agreed to help Sarah move this weekend.
Tôi dã đồng ý giúp Sarah chuyển nhà vào cuối tuần

children.name: take
children.definition: /teɪk/  if you take anopportunityor ajobthat someone offers you, you accept it:
examples: Nhận, lấy
▪ Stephen says he’ll take the job if the money’s right.
Stephen nói rằng anh ấy sẽ nhận việc nếu tiền bạc hợp lí
▪ This is a wonderful opportunity -- I think you should take it.
Quả là một cơ hội tuyệ vời -- tôi nghĩ bạn nên nhận đi

children.name: say yes
children.definition: /seɪ ˈjes/ spokenif someone says yes, they agree to do what you have asked or invited them to do
examples: Đồng ý, vâng:
▪ We’d really like you to come to France with us this summer. Please say yes!
Chúng tôi thật sự muốn bạn đến Pháp với chúng tôi mùa hè này. Làm ơn đồng ý đi!
▪ David doesn’t usually lend his car to anyone, so I was surprised when he said yes.
David không thường xuyên cho ai mượn xe của anh ta, vậy nên tôi rất ngạc nhiên khi anh ta đồng ý
say yes to (doing) something
đồng ý làm việc gì
▪ Do you really think your parents will say yes to letting you stay out late this Friday night?
Bạn có thật sự nghĩ bố mẹ bạn sẽ đồng ý cho bạn về nhà trễ tối thứ sáu này chứ ?

children.name: take up sb's offer U
children.definition: take sb up on/ take up sb’s offer/ˌteɪk somebody ˈʌp ɒn , ˌteɪk ʌp somebodyˈs ˈɒfəʳǁ-ˈɔːf-/  to accept someone’s offer to do something for you, especially when you accept the offer some time after it was made: chấp nhận lời đề nghị của ai đó
examples: ‘If you ever need a babysitter, let me know.’ ‘Thanks, I might take you up on that some time.’take up somebody’s offer of something
In the end, Rick took up his parents’ offer of a loan.

children.name: jump at
children.definition: the chance/opportunity toeagerlyaccept an offer to do sth:chộp cơ hội, chấp nhận ngay
examples: Marla jumped at the chance to spend a year working in her company’s UK office.

children.name: to officially accept a new law or proposal
pass
children.definition: if a parliament or similar group passes a law or proposal, the members vote to accept it:thông qua
examples: The State Assembly passed a law which banned smoking in public places.
pass by
The bill was passed by 197 votes to 50.

children.name: approve
children.definition: to officially accept something that has been planned to happen: phê chuẩn, phê duyệ
examples: The Medical Research Council said it could not approve the use of the new drug without further tests
Congress voted not to approve the President’s plans for cutting the arms budget.
approval[uncountable noun] when a suggestion or plan is officially accepted:
The government recently gave its approval to several US companies to sell satellite and other hi-tech equipment on the open market.

children.name: ratify
children.definition: /ˈrætɪfaɪ, ˈrætəfaɪ/
examples: Thông qua, phê chuẩn
ratify an agreement/treaty
to officially agree to accept an agreement that someone else has already agreed to accept:
( thông qua, phê chuẩn, phê duyệt )
▪ The US Senate refused to ratify the agreement on weapons reduction.
Thượng nghị viện Hoa Kì từ chối phê chuẩn quyết định về việc giảm cấp vũ kí
▪ A 1961 treaty ratified by 125 nations outlawed the production of cocaine.
Hiệp ước năm 1961 đã thông qua bở 125 quốc qua cấm sự sản xuất thuốc phiện
ratification/ˌrætɪfəˈkeɪʃən, ˌrætəfəˈkeɪʃən/ [uncountable noun] when an agreement is officially signed or agreed upon:
Sự thông qua, sự phê chuẩn
▪ Without ratification the agreement cannot be implemented.
Không có sự phê chuẩn, một quyết định không thể được thi hành

children.name: be carried
children.definition: /biː ˈkærid/  if a suggestion, proposal etc is carried, most of the people at an official meeting vote in favour of it and it is accepted:được thông qua
examples: ▪ Chao’s proposal for a new downtown parking facility was carried at yesterday’s council meeting.
be carried by 20 votes/100 votes etc
▪ The motion to restrict handgun sales was carried by 76 votes 76 more people voted for it than voted against it.

children.name: uphold
children.definition: if a court or a judge upholds a legal decision made by another court, they decide that it is right and they accept it: xác nhận, chứng thực, phê chuẩn
examples: The court’s decision upheld state laws prohibiting doctor-assisted suicide.uphold by
The decision was upheld by the US Supreme Court late last year.

children.name: rubber-stamp
children.definition: if an official committee or sb in authority rubber-stamps a decision, they approve itimmediatelywithout thinking about it or discussing it because they have no real power of their own:tán thành
examples: The town council usually rubber-stamped anything the mayor sent their way.

children.name: to take money or a gift that sb offers you
accept
children.definition: Accept/əkˈsept/ is moreformalthan take:
examples: ▪ We hope you’ll accept this small gift.
accept something from somebody
▪ A Senate candidate can accept up to $2,000 from individual campaign donors.

children.name: take
children.definition: /teɪk/  to take something someone offers you, especially money or a gift.
examples: Lấy, giữ, nhận
▪ Mark gave us a lot of helpful advice, but he refused to take any payment for it.
Mark cho chúng tôi rất nhiều lời khuyên bổ ích, nhưng anh ấy từ chối nhận tiền công cho điều ấy
take something from somebody
Lấy thứ gì từ ai đó
▪ My mother always warned us never to take candy from strangers.
Mẹ của chúng tôi luôn luôn cảnh báo rằng chúng tôi không được lấy kẹo từ người lạ
take bribes
Ăn hối lộ
▪ Ochoa was formally accused of taking bribes.
Ochoa bị chính thức buộc tội đã ăn hối lội
take it or leave itsaid when telling someone that you will not change your offer
Không lấy thì thôi
▪ I’ll give you $500 for the car. Take it or leave it.
Tôi sẽ trả anh $500 cho cái xe ấy, Không lấy thì thôi.

children.name: welcome
children.definition: /ˈwelkəm/  to think that a plan, suggestion, or decision is very good, and eagerly accept it: hưởng ứng, tiếp nhận
examples: ▪ Some companies have welcomed the idea of employees working from home.
Vài công ty đã hưởng ứng với ý tưởng nhân viên làm việc tại nhà
▪ The university’s cafeteria welcomes any suggestions for improvement of its menu or service.
Quán ăn tự phục vụ của trường đại học tiếp nhận mọi lời gợi ý để phát triển thực đơn và dịch vụ ở đây
be warmly welcomed
▪ The proposal was warmly welcomed by the German Chancellor.

children.name: embrace
children.definition: /ɪmˈbreɪs/  formal to eagerly accept ideas, opinions etc: hưởng ứng
examples: ▪ By the end of the last century, Americans had embraced the idea of the right to free public education for all children.
Vào cuối thế kỷ vừa rồi, người Mỹ đã hưởng ứng ý kiến về quyền được miễn phí giáo dục cho tất cả trẻ em
embrace sth wholeheartedly /wholeheartedly embrace sth embrace it completely
▪ The President said he wholeheartedly embraced the need for further talks on the refugee crisis

children.name: accept
children.definition: /əkˈsept/  to agree that a suggestion or idea is right,especially when you did not previously think so:chấp nhập, chấp thuận
examples: ▪ People are beginning to accept the idea that higher taxes may be necessary.
accept that
▪ The judge accepted that Carter did not mean to harm anyone.
acceptance[uncountable noun]
▪ These theories have not found much acceptance among professional psychiatrists they do not accept that the theories are true.

children.name: agree
children.definition: /əˈgriː/ to accept that a plan or suggestion is good, especially when you have the power to decide whether it will be allowed to happen:
examples: Bằng lòng, đồng ý
▪ I spoke to my boss yesterday about postponing the meeting and she agreed.
agree to
▪ We want to have a big party, but I don’t think my parents will agree to it.agree that
▪ The music teacher agreed that Dave should play at the school concert.

children.name: take on board
children.definition: British to realize that a new idea or suggestion is important and that itneeds to be thought about seriously:tiếp thu, tiếp nhận
examples: take sth on board
The local government says it has taken much of the public’s criticism on board and it promises to make changes.
take on board sth
The management says that it will take on board suggestions from employees about child-care facilities.

children.name: go with
children.definition: especially spoken use this to say that you are willing to accept and support a plan or suggestion that sb has made: đồng ý kiến, nhất trí
examples: ‘What do you think of Jo’s idea?’ ‘I think we should go with it - I can’t think of anything better.

children.name: take
children.definition: chấp nhận
examples: ▪ Will you take a cheque?

children.name: accept
children.definition: chấp nhận
examples: ▪ The hotel accepts all major credit cards.
▪ I’m afraid we only accept cash.

children.name: agree to
children.definition: sth to decide to allow sb to do sth because you have been persuaded to allow it : chấp nhận cái gì ( bị thuyết phục )
examples: The rebels finally agreed to a ban on terrorist activity.
McCaskill left the California Angels on Saturday and agreed to a three-year contract with the Chicago White Sox worth over $6 million.

children.name: respect
children.definition: verbHONOUR
examples: to accept the importance of someone's rights or customs and to do nothing that would harm them or cause them offence
_The agreement will respect the rights of both nations.
_I would appreciate it if you would respect myprivacy.

children.name: establish
children.definition: to cause to be accepted in or familiar with a place, position, etc
examples: His reputation for carelessness was established long before the latest problems arose.
He's established himselfasa dependable source of information.

children.name: settlement
children.definition: nounAGREEdàn xếp, hòa hợp
examples: [ C or U ] an official agreement that finishes an argument
_It now seems unlikely that it will be possible tonegotiate/reacha peaceful settlementofthe conflict.
_As part of their divorce settlement, Geoff agreed to let Polly keep the house.

children.name: reconcile
children.definition: verbhòa hợp; làm cho nhất trí
examples: to find a way in which two situations or beliefs that are
opposed to each other can agree and exist together
_It is sometimes difficult to reconcile science and religion.
_It's difficult to reconcile such different points of view.
_How can you reconcile your fur coatand/withyour love of animals?
_the possibility remains that the two approaches may be reconciled
khả năng còn lại là hai phương pháp này có thể hòa hợp với nhau
_reconcile differences
hòagiảinhững bấtđồng
_reconcile one's principles with one's actions
làm cho nguyên tắc nhất trí với hành động

children.name: sympathy
children.definition: nounSUPPORT
examples: [ U ] support and agreement
_I must confess I have some sympathywithhis views.

children.name: I daresay
children.definition: (alsoI dare say)
examples: used to say that you agree or think that something is true
_"She's got a lot of admirers." "I daresay - she's very beautiful."
_He gets paid a lot of money, but I daresay(that)he earns it.

children.name: see eye to eye
children.definition: if two people see eye to eye, they agree with each other
examples: see eye to eye with sb
My sistersdon'tsee eye to eyewithme about the arrangements.
